intro: Plocoglottis pseudomoluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant typically features smooth, green stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a slightly rough texture. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks.
